samples.context: Plague is confirmed by Wayson stain test. Anti-plague vaccine, spray of insecticides, killing of rats, nose caps and high cots (rat flea can jump up to 45 cm) are some preventive measures.
samples.question: What tests are used to confirm plague?

samples.context: Anti-plague vaccine, spray of insecticides, killing of rats, nose caps and high cots (rat flea can jump up to 45 cm) are some preventive measures.
samples.question: What are some preventive measures for plague?

samples.context: Streptomycin or oral tetracycline is effective against plague.
samples.question: Which antibiotics are effective against plague?

samples.context: Wayson stain test is used to confirm the presence of plague.
samples.question: What is the purpose of the Wayson stain test?

samples.context: Spray of insecticides, killing of rats, nose caps and high cots are used to prevent plague.
samples.question: How can rats help in the spread of plague?
